title: Christian Louboutin teams up with Bhutanese craftspeople to make his most incredible high heels to date
text:
With their trademark red soles, his shoes are arguably the most recognisable on the planet, worn on catwalks and red carpets the world over.

So at first glance, Parisian shoemaker Christian Louboutin's collaboration with craftspeople in the small remote Buddhist kingdom of Bhutan - a country famed for its monasteries, fortresses and treks through dramatic Himalayan landscapes - may seem a bit incongruous.

Not so, says Louboutin of the 13-piece 'Loubhoutan' collection, the result of a six-year "artistic and creative dialogue" with students at the National Institute for Zorig Chusum, also known as the School of the Thirteen Royal Arts and Crafts in Thimphu, the kingdom's capital city.

"Of course,...
description: With their trademark red soles, his shoes are arguably the most recognisable on the planet, worn on catwalks and red carpets the world over.
